decks.notes: The deck focuses on aggressive plays with powerful Eldrazi creatures, using cards like Simian Spirit Guide to ramp into threats quickly. Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer disrupt opponents' strategies, while cards like Dismember and Endbringer provide additional removal and control options. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast start and resilient threats, taking advantage of the Eldrazi tribal synergies and powerful lands like Ancient Tomb and Eye of Ugin. Overall, the deck is built to apply pressure early and capitalize on its disruptive elements to secure a quick victory.

The Grixis Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence and applying pressure with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, and True-Name Nemesis. The deck uses disruptive spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce to protect its threats while also disrupting the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck is able to control the opponent's mana base through the use of Wasteland and capitalize on its own powerful card selection with cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through a combination of aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on using a combination of removal spells, card advantage generators, and disruptive elements to control the pace of the game and out-value opponent's resources. It utilizes powerful creatures like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage to apply pressure while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach. The deck also has a strong mana denial aspect with cards like Wasteland and Kolaghan's Command to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The goal is to grind out the opponent and win through attrition.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, True-Name Nemesis, and Young Pyromancer to apply pressure early on while disrupting opponents with efficient spells like Stifle, Spell Pierce, Lightning Bolt, Force of Will, and Daze. The deck also includes disruptive lands like Wasteland to keep opponents off balance. By combining efficient spells with powerful creatures, this deck aims to control the pace of the game and overwhelm opponents with a quick and strategic assault.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disruption, card advantage, and maintaining control over the game. It uses a mixture of counterspells like Force of Will, removal spells like Fatal Push and Kolaghan's Command, and hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to out-value the opponent. With an array of versatile threats like Baleful Strix and Gurmag Angler, this deck aims to grind out the opponent and win through attrition.

The key concept of this Grixis Control deck is to maintain board control through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Snapcaster Mage, Baleful Strix, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Kolaghan's Command while generating card advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Deathrite Shaman and Leovold, Emissary of Trest allows for graveyard interaction and card draw denial, further solidifying the deck's control strategy.

This deck focuses on using lands as a resource to control the game. By utilizing cards like "Crop Rotation" and "Life from the Loam," the player can manipulate their lands to their advantage, while also preventing the opponent from developing their board. The inclusion of cards like "Maze of Ith" and "The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale" further solidify the control aspect of the deck, making it difficult for the opponent to mount an offense. Additionally, the combo of "Dark Depths" and "Thespian's Stage" provides a powerful win condition that can quickly end the game.

This legacy aggro deck focuses on controlling the pace of the game by utilizing disruptive spells like Spell Pierce and Force of Will, while also utilizing efficient removal with Fatal Push and Swords to Plowshares. The deck aims to quickly deploy threats like Delver of Secrets and Gurmag Angler to pressure the opponent, while also generating card advantage with cards like Thought Scour and Lingering Souls. The deck also utilizes a versatile mana base with dual lands and Wasteland to ensure consistent access to different colors of mana.

This deck focuses on utilizing cards like Life from the Loam, Punishing Fire, and Knight of the Reliquary to control the board and disrupt your opponent's strategy. By recurring lands, destroying your opponent's resources, and utilizing Chalice of the Void to lock down their spells, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent. With a toolbox of creatures like Scavenging Ooze and Gaddock Teeg, along with powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil, this deck is designed for a slow, methodical approach to the game, grinding out victories in the long run.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently generate a large amount of mana using cards like Dark Ritual, Cabal Ritual, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Lotus Petal, in order to cast spells like Ad Nauseam and Tendrils of Agony. The deck also includes a variety of card selection and disruption spells to help find key combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and execute a lethal storm turn to win the game before the opponent can stop you.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker, while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Flickerwisp and Mirran Crusader. It also utilizes Stoneforge Mystic to tutor up powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to further enhance its board presence. This deck aims to control the game through disruptive elements while presenting a fast clock to close out the game. Additionally, it utilizes cards like Aether Vial and Wasteland to maximize its efficiency and disrupt opponents' mana bases.

The main idea of this control Landstill deck is to lock down the opponent with cards like Standstill, Humility, and Supreme Verdict while maintaining card advantage through powerful spells like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy with counterspells and removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The deck also has a versatile mana base with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistency in casting its spells and controlling the game.

This UWx Control deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and control the board through counterspells, removal spells like Terminus and Swords to Plowshares, and card selection with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Predict. The deck also includes win conditions in the form of Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, and Council's Judgment. With a splash of red for cards like Blood Moon and Volcanic Island, this deck is designed to outvalue opponents and maintain control of the game while setting up for a victory.

The deck focuses on using powerful control elements like counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently deploying threats like Stoneforge Mystic and True-Name Nemesis to apply pressure. The inclusion of versatile cards like Force of Will and Snapcaster Mage allows for flexibility in adapting to various situations, while planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar provide additional win conditions and card advantage. The deck aims to control the game and out value the opponent to secure victory.

This Legacy deck aims to quickly disrupt the opponent's resources while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Will, Daze, and Hymn to Tourach to control the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Leovold, Emissary of Trest adds versatility and additional disruption to the deck. Overall, this deck focuses on a proactive game plan that aims to quickly close out the game while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly through rituals and mana-producing artifacts to assemble a lethal storm count, typically using Infernal Tutor to find the win condition, Tendrils of Agony. It also utilizes disruption spells like Cabal Therapy and Duress to clear the path for the combo to go off. The deck aims to cast a critical mass of spells in a single turn, leading to a game-ending Tendrils of Agony or an overwhelming swarm of goblin tokens through Empty the Warrens.
